cheatsheet.title: Copying files between local machine and grid

intro.description:
Sometimes on your local machine you have prepared files containing data, which should be processed by job on grid.
Additionally job can produce results to files, which you want to have on your local machine.
In this cheat you will learn how to copy files between local machine and grid.

item.title: Open the g-Eclipse user perspective
item.description: If you are not already in the g-Eclipse user perspective, in the main menu select Window / Open Perspective / g-Eclipse (User) or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

subitem.label: Go to view "Grid Project", select "Filesystems", and from context menu select "New / Grid Connection".
Enter connection name (e.g. "localhost") and press button "Next".
Enter path to directory, in which your store data files on your local machine, and press button "Finish"

item.title: Create connection to Storage on Grid

subitem.label: Go to view "Grid Project", expand Virtual Organization in your project (blue icon), and expand "Storage".
Select any storage. From context menu run "Mount".

item.title: Copying files
item.description:
Since you have local and grid connections, you can explore these storages and copy files between its using Drag&Drop technique.
The best way to do it is to open local and grid connection in two views.

subitem.label: In view "Grid Projects", under "Filesystems" find destination directory, to which you want to copy files.
Explore source connection, and select files, which you want to copy.
Drag selected files, move mouse over view "Grid Projects" to directory, which you found previously, and drop its here.
